intro: Hieracium laricicola, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium laricicola is often found in association with coniferous forests, particularly in areas with cooler climates.
